channel.title: At the Start of Your Phd on CSE PhD council
channel.description: Recent content in At the Start of Your Phd on CSE PhD council

item.title: Internet
item.description: Wireless access to eduroam There is an installer in eduroam website (even for Linux) that embedded the eduroam certificate. Manual setup Login ID: CID@chalmers.se Anonymous ID: empty Password: CID password Authentication: MSCHAPv2 EAP type: PEAP Eduroam certificate is in eduroam.pem Change password for CID / NOMAD Go toCDKS Home directory of remote servers You have a limited (but large) space at Chalmers servers just for you! - enter in your Termial - type ‘ssh -X CID@remote12.

item.title: Library
item.description: Access material when off-campus Add your publications to CLP Books You can request and access material such as books and articles you need for you research at the Library website You can request/recommand a (paper/online) book for library. (the book doesn’t necessary need to be relevant to your research area). Lending times: Books : 1-3 weeks E-book, articles: 1-3 days

item.title: Printing / Printers
item.description: Printer Web interface to printers You can use web interface to see nearby printers, download drivers or directly send pdf, txt files to be printed. Setup on linux with SMB (tested on Ubuntu 18.x, 16.x, 14.x, 12.x) See instructions here. Printing via ipp/kerberos: Copy krb5.conf in this repository to /etc/krb5.conf and run: test -d $HOME/.cups || mkdir $HOME/.cups cat <<EOF >$HOME/.cups/client.conf ServerName print.chalmers.se GSSServiceName HTTP EOF In older versions of CUPS, you may have to add those lines to the system-wide configuration file in /etc/cups/client.

item.title: Software
item.description: Free commercial software Worth looking (OS and utitily software(antivirus) and domain specific softwares like MATLAB and …) Windows share: smb://syros.ce.chalmers.se \\syros.ce.chalmers.se Domain: NET username: CID syros directory tree output of “tree -L 3 -d” on smb://syros.ce.chalmers.se/program/ Microsoft tools Different version of Windows (even ancient DOS), SQL server and visual studio and more. You need to specify your university (Chalmers). Microsoft tools Almost everything except MS-Office which is accessable from SYROS server.

item.title: Primula
item.description: Report vacations, leave, expenses Chalmers employees use the Primula portal to apply for vacation days and leave, report sick days, and apply to be compensated for travel expenses and other expenses. You log in with your CID username and password. Here you can also check how many vacation days you have left (or accumulated), your employment statements and records. Do not forget to keep you Personal Data page up-to-date (in particular if you move to a new address).
